name: generational

relating to different generations (= groups of people or members of a family who are around the same age): generational divide Reactions to the changes seem to reflect a generational divide.generational shift A generational shift is taking place as newer, younger business leaders emerge.generational rift/split/gap These social events aim to help bridge the generational rift/split/gap within communities.
More examplesFewer examplesMany of these books and films successfully cross generational lines.Worries about an elderly parent's driving can be a source of generational conflict.The challenge of working for a younger boss is dealing with different generational work styles. The political movement seems to be in the midst of a generational split, as older figures decline in influence.The differences are partly generational.
